Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET) offers the following Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) courses:
- Computer Science & Engineering (CSE): 75 seats
- Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE): 75 seats
- Civil Engineering (CE): 75 seats
- Mechanical Engineering (ME): 75 seats

For more details, please visit: https://ccet.ac.in/degreeCourse.php

text: How many blocks does CCET have?
Tell me about the campus infrastructure of CCET?

responses: CCET has various functional zones, including Academic and Administrative Blocks. The campus includes spacious lecture halls, tutorial rooms, drawing halls, an auditorium, a library, a computer center, reading rooms, workshops, and well-equipped laboratories. Hostel facilities are available for both boys and girls.

text: How many labs are there in each department?
List of laboratories available in CCET?
What labs are available in the CSE department?
What facilities are available in the ECE labs?
responses:
CCET has well-equipped laboratories for practical learning.
- **Computer Science & Engineering:** AI & Data Mining Lab, Software Engineering Lab, Networking Lab, Web Technology Lab, and more.
- **Electronics & Communication Engineering:** Digital Image Processing Lab, Wireless Communication Lab, VLSI Lab, and more.
- **Mechanical Engineering:** CAD/CAM Lab, Robotics Lab, and Thermal Engineering Lab.
- **Civil Engineering:** Concrete Technology Lab, Structural Analysis Lab, and Geotechnical Lab.

text: How is grading done at CCET?
What is the evaluation system at CCET?
How are internal and external marks calculated?
What is the grading scale used at CCET?
responses:
CCET follows a continuous evaluation system:
- **Internal Assessment: 30% weightage (Minor-1 and Minor-2, assignments, quizzes, attendance).
- End Semester Examination: 50% weightage.
- Final grading: Based on SGPA and CGPA system.
- Students must secure at least 20% in End Semester Examination to pass a subject.
- Attendance below 75% results in penalties or F grade.

Our University has excellent infrastructure. The campus is clean, equipped with modern facilities, and has good labs with high-speed internet connections.There are 4 blocks in our college 'Block A' is for applied Science,CSE and ECE ,'Block B' is for mech. and civil branch . 'Block E is for workshops and 'block c' is for library,seminarhalls and academic cell

text: What scholarships are available at CCET?
responses: CCET offers multiple scholarships including: - **Merit-Cum-Means Scholarships**: Awarded based on academic performance and financial need. Family income must not exceed ‚Çπ18,000 per year, and students must maintain at least 60% marks. - **Government Necessitous Scholarships**: Financial aid for students from economically weaker backgrounds. - **Chandigarh Union Territory Merit-Cum-Means Scholarships**: Provided based on merit from semester results. - **Free Education for Meritorious SC/OBC Students**: Covers tuition fees, annual allowances, and travel reimbursements. - **Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme for Economically Weaker Sections (EWS)**: Full tuition fee exemption for students with family income under ‚Çπ8 lakh per year. For more details, visit here.

text: How is the placement at CCET?
responses: CCET has a dedicated Training and Placement Cell that collaborates with top companies for recruitment, internships, and industrial training. To know more about placements, visit here

text: Is CCET recognized by the government?
Is CCET affiliated with Panjab University?
responses: Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET) Degree Wing is approved by the **All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)** and affiliated with **Panjab University (PU), Chandigarh**. The institute follows the academic guidelines issued by PU and adheres to AICTE norms. It has received accreditation from **NBA (National Board of Accreditation)** for its engineering programs, ensuring high-quality education and industry relevance. The college is a government institute under the **UT Administration of Chandigarh**. For more details, visit here.

text: What is the anti-ragging policy at CCET?
responses: CCET follows a strict anti-ragging policy as per UGC guidelines. Ragging is strictly prohibited and punishable under law.

text: What are the minimum eligibility criteria for admission?
Tell me about the admission criteria.
What qualifications do I need to get admitted?
What are the eligibility requirements for engineering courses?
How can I apply for admission?
What marks are required for admission?
Tell me about admission for B.E.
What is the eligibility for lateral entry admission?
What are the criteria for B.E. and Integrated B.E. admission?
responses:
The admission criteria are as follows:

1. **First Semester Admission:** Candidates must have passed the 10+2 examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following: Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science, or Biology. A minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination (+2) is required, except for SC/ST/Physically Handicapped categories, which require 55%.

2. **JEE (Mains):** Admission is based on the merit of JEE (Mains) conducted by CBSE.

3. **Second Year (Lateral Entry):** Candidates must have passed a 3-year Diploma from a recognized State Board of Technical Education with 60% marks. Admission will be based on merit obtained in the Entrance Examination conducted by Panjab University.

text: How can I check my exam results?
Where can I find my semester results?
When will the results be announced?
What is the process to view my marks?
responses: Exam results are typically announced after the semester-end examinations. You can check your results on the official website of Panjab University (puchd.ac.in) or through the university's student portal. Major examinations are held in November/December and May/June.

text: Where do I pay my college fees?
What are the payment methods for college fees?
What is the deadline for fee submission?
Can I pay my fees online?
How much is the tuition fee for this semester?
responses: The fee submission details, including deadlines and payment methods, are provided by the Accounts Office.The student should submit their fee through the qfix system. The tuition fee varies based on the course and category. Visit the official college website (www.ccet.ac.in) or contact the Accounts Office for more details.

text: How can I submit my examination form?
Where do I submit my examination form?
What documents are needed for the exam form?
When is the last date to submit the exam form?
How can I get a copy of my submitted exam form?
responses:
Hi there! To submit your examination form at CCET, please follow these steps:

1. **Check the Deadline:** First, review the academic calendar to know the last date for form submission.

2. **Obtain the Form:** Detailed instructions and the online submission portal can be found on the official CCET website at: [https://www.ccet.ac.in/admission-guidelines].. **Fill and Attach Documents:** Carefully complete the form and attach all required documents as specified in the form instructions.

4. **Submit the Form:** Once completed, submit your form along with the documents to the Examination Branch before the deadline.

For detailed instructions and any updates, please check the official examination notice on the CCET website.

text: What clubs are available at CCET?
Tell me about the official clubs at CCET
Which student clubs does the college have?
How can I join a club at CCET?
What extracurricular clubs does CCET offer?
responses: CCET offers a variety of official student clubs designed to promote academic, cultural, technical, and sports activities. These clubs include the Editorial Board, Speakers Club, Panache, Projection Club, Dramatics Club, Sports Club, Music Club, IT Club, and more. For detailed information on each club, including activities and registration procedures, please visit the clubs section on the CCET official website.

text: How can I apply for admission?
What is the admission process for BE courses?
Is there a lateral entry option?
What is the eligibility for admission?
responses: Admissions to BE programs are conducted through the Joint Admission Committee (JAC) Chandigarh. Candidates must have passed 10+2 with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects. Lateral entry admissions are based on PUMEET/PULEET entrance tests.

text: What courses does the college offer?
What is the syllabus for Computer Science?
How many credits do I need to pass the semester?

responses: The college offers BE programs in Civil, Computer Science, Electronics & Communication, and Mechanical Engineering. Each program follows a credit-based system. For detailed syllabus, visit puchd.ac.in/syllabus.
